text: Randolph Guggenheimer (July 20, 1846 – September 12, 1907) was a politician in New York City who served as the inaugural President of the Council of the City of Greater New York from 1898 through 1901. He was Jewish, and a philanthropist towards many Jewish causes. He died at his home in Elberon on September 12, 1907. ==References== Category:Jewish American people in New York (state) politics Category:New York City Council members Category:1846 births Category:1907 deaths Category:People from Lynchburg, Virginia
title: Randolph Guggenheimer (politician)
